Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, loyalty targeting and other business outcomes.

You are someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests and be able to grow professionally.

You bring to Applaudo the following competencies:
• Minimum 2 years of experience in positions related to machine learning.
• Programming languages: R, Python.
• DB: Sql, pandas, spark.
• Cloud: AWS or GCP (minimum experience about deployments).
• Strong knowledge about machine learning techniques: Computer vision, clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, NLP, classification models.
• Strong knowledge about statistical techniques: regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, hypothesis testing, correlations and modeling, probability theory, bayesian... statistics, XGBoost, text mining, GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees.
• Familiarity with the following data modeling / visualization: plotly, seaborn, dash, tableau, powerBI, datastudios, D3
• Experience about deploying microservices: Airflow Pipelines, prefect, Hybrid Cloud and Cloud, DevOps skills, CI/CD pipelines.
• Good conversational level in English.

You will be accountable for the following responsibilities:
• Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
• Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
• Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
• Ability to articulate and present insight into the working of relevant algorithms and models.

Additional Information

Here at Applaudo Studios values as trust, communication, respect, excellence and team work are our keys to success. We know we are working with the best and thus treat each other with respect and admiration without asking.

Submit your application today, and don't miss this opportunity to join the Best Digital team in the Region!

We truly appreciate all the hard and outstanding work our team makes every day at Applaudo Studios, and that's why the perks that we offer, are deeply thought and designed as a way to thank them for their commitment and excellence.

Some of our perks and benefits:
• Work from home
• Flexible schedule
• Celebrations
• Special discounts
• Entertainment area
• Flexible work spaces
• Great work environment
• Private medical insurance
• Benefits may vary according to your location and/or availability. Request further information when applying

We are looking for a AI/Machine Learning Engineer to build the MVP for a SaaS product. If you can contribute around 20 hours a week would be ideal but its not necessary. Better if you can speak a bit of spanish.

Equity only No experience requiered but knowledge is

Workarise focuses on SaaS, B2B, and Project Management. Their company has offices in Remote. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at http://workarise.com/

Who we are

At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.

Job Description Summary:
The PayPal Personalization AI team designs, builds, maintains, and improves the machine learning models and ML infrastructure that are used by various PayPal domains serving millions of users. As a Staff Data Scientist in our fast-moving, small entrepreneurial team, you will design and build performance metrics for the evaluation of ML models, and shape the business strategy for Personalization at PayPal. You will guide the product decisions on high visibility projects that benefit millions of users world wide.

Job Description:

Responsibilities:
• Design and build performance metrics for A/B testing recommendation models
• Use and promote data exploration techniques to discover new opportunities for personalization
• Influence stakeholders on product decisions by making compelling cases through data analysis and visualization
• Work closely with ML engineers and product managers to help understand performance impact of ML models on various domains and provide guidance on model improvement directions

Requirements:
• BS/MS in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field
• 3+ years of full-time experience as Data Scientist or similar role
• Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
• Deep understanding of statistics, especially hypothesis testing and A/B testing
• Experience with relational databases and query authoring (SQL)
• Experience with programming languages such as Python, Java, etc.
• Experience with data visualization tools

PayPal

For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

As part of PayPal’s commitment to employees’ health and safety, we have established in-office Covid-19 protocols and requirements, based on expert guidance. Depending on location, this might include a Covid-19 vaccination requirement for any employee whose role requires them to work onsite. Employees may request reasonable accommodation based on a medical condition or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated

Job Description Summary:
PayPal product analytics is hiring a data scientist who can unlock new insights to take our Giving business to new heights.

If you have the drive, tenacity and grit to execute, measure, and move fast, you’ll thrive on our team. We are highly customer-centric and believe deeply in doing our best work on behalf of customers. This role demands problem solving, partnership, product vision and a passion for digging through data to gain insights that add value to the business.

Job Description:

Job Responsibilities
Act as a thought partner to our product team to build and lead cross-functional projects (partner teams include product, engineering, design, user research, finance, machine learning, marketing, compliance, risk, customer service/operations) Identify new growth opportunities through deep dive analyses leveraging our rich datasets of user behavioral and transactional data Translate ambiguous, unstructured business problems into actionable data-driven... analyses Ability to craft a compelling story and present recommendations across teams and levels including both technical and non-technical audiences Help to launch, measure, and scale new solutions to create seamless consumer experiences and drive incremental revenue Size potential impact of new ideas and help prioritize product roadmaps based on impact Support multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment

You have:

in a quantitative field (math, statistics, computer science, or similar STEM fields), advanced degrees a plus Experience influencing product strategy through analyses and data-centric presentations Ability to independently break down large datasets and synthesize inputs from multiple sources Experience with one or multiple of the following will be highly desirable; Python, Tableau, Jupyter Notebooks, Teradata, Hadoop/Hive, SQL, BigQuery Comfortable with working with large, complex, and potentially messy datasets Understanding of statistics ( hypothesis testing, statistical inference, regression), experience designing and evaluating complex experiments a plus Strong interpersonal and communication skills Ability to act as a thought partner and interact cross-functionally Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau a plus, experience with building machine learning models a plus

Additional Job Description:

Subsidiary:
PayPal

Travel Percent:
0

Our Benefits:
At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit

At a high level JD characteristics we are looking for:

- Rough and ready prototyping but also more mature pipelines
- Data science, Machine Learning modeling and Machine Learning data pipelines
- Capable of synthesizing quantitative information
- Strong STEM background, preferred building data-intensive.
- Proficient in predictive modeling, data processing, and data mining algorithms, as well as scripting languages.
- Data transformation experience, modeling and reporting
- Data integration
- Development and deployment of Machine Learning models
- Development of applications and automation flows.
- English is required (Written and spoken)

PayPal product analytics is hiring a data scientist who can unlock new insights to take our Giving business to new heights.

If you have the drive, tenacity and grit to execute, measure, and move fast, you'll thrive on our team. We are highly customer-centric and believe deeply in doing our best work on behalf of customers. This role demands problem solving, partnership, product vision and a passion for digging through data to gain insights that add value to the business.

Job Description:

Job Responsibilities
• Act as a thought partner to our product team to build and lead cross-functional projects (partner teams include product, engineering, design, user research, finance, machine learning, marketing, compliance, risk, customer service/operations)
• Identify new growth opportunities through deep dive analyses leveraging our rich datasets of user behavioral and transactional data
• Translate ambiguous, unstructured business problems into actionable... data-driven analyses
• Ability to craft a compelling story and present recommendations across teams and levels including both technical and non-technical audiences

• in a quantitative field (math, statistics, computer science, or similar STEM fields), advanced degrees a plus

Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 375 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.
We are looking for a Data Scientist with a... positive attitude, an awesome team player, a customer champion, a rock star in preventing online fraud who has a data driven mindset that can help upscale our risk detection capabilities and provide innovative solutions based on automation, efficiency and accuracy in a high energy, fast paced, ever evolving environment.

Xoom, A PayPal Service, is revolutionizing the global digital money services market by providing people with an easy, convenient, and cost-effective means of sending money worldwide. We offer a secure, fast, and inexpensive means of sending money, paying bills and topping up prepaid services across multiple digital platforms to both online and offline recipients in over 160 countries and counting.

Responsibilities
• Works on multiple assignments simultaneously and in all areas of a standard project in the area of responsibility related to managing and mitigating Xoom financial loss caused by fraud risk (ACH returns, card chargeback and account take-over).
• Accountable for own results. Reviews are mainly for consultation and sharing ideas
• Focuses primarily on how to achieve overall analytic objectives of a project with speed and quality.
• Suggests ideas for operational and analytical plans and objectives?
• Clear subject matter expert who can help mentor and coach junior risk analysts or data scientist
• Works independently and proficiently on multiple assignments simultaneously with speed and quality
• Has working knowledge of internal and external business processes, and data, systems and flows, as well as analytic tools, processes, and methodologies to achieve the expected results with minimum supervision
• Has a good understanding of Risk business trends and directions to be able to put own work in the broad business context
• Identify glitches in processes and tools and develop and execute solutions to overcome general issues and obstacles with little supervision.
• Learning in-depth analysis of alternatives and applying specialized knowledge
• Impact of decision has moderate reach
• Seeks improvement within defined tasks. Understands, evaluates, and executes improvement ideas from supervisors.?
• Build risk related variables based on fraudulent trends and insights
• Partner with key stakeholders to design new risk platform to ensure better quality of risk strategies

Requirements
• Segmentation strategies based on statistical modeling
• Data analysis and visualization
• Machine learning
• PySpark, Python
• SQL
• Hadoop / Hive
• Unix
• Executive/Senior Manager presentation skills
• Story telling skills

Education
• Master’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Statistics, Mathematics, or closely related quantitative discipline plus four (4) years of experience in the job offered or four (4) years of experience in the field of data analysis or statistical analysis
• OR Bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Statistics, Mathematics or closely related quantitative discipline plus six (6) years of experience in the job offered or six (6) years of progressively responsible experience in the field of data analysis or statistical analysis

Who we are

At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.

Job Description Summary:
Xoom, A PayPal Service, is revolutionizing the global digital money services market by providing people with an easy, convenient, and cost-effective means of sending money worldwide. We offer a secure, fast, and inexpensive means of sending money, paying bills and topping up prepaid services across multiple digital platforms to both online and offline recipients in over 160 countries and counting.

We are looking for a Data Scientist with a positive attitude, an awesome team player, a customer champion, a rock star in preventing online fraud who has a data driven mindset that can help upscale our risk detection capabilities and provide innovative solutions based on automation, efficiency and accuracy in a high energy, fast paced, ever evolving environment.

Job Description:

Specific responsibilities include
• Works on multiple assignments simultaneously and in all areas of a standard project in the area of responsibility related to managing and mitigating Xoom financial loss caused by fraud risk (ACH returns, card chargeback and account take-over).
• Accountable for own results. Reviews are mainly for consultation and sharing ideas
• Focuses primarily on how to achieve overall analytic objectives of a project with speed and quality.
• Suggests ideas for operational and analytical plans and objectives
• Clear subject matter expert who can help mentor and coach junior risk analysts or data scientist
• Works independently and proficiently on multiple assignments simultaneously with speed and quality
• Has working knowledge of internal and external business processes, and data, systems and flows, as well as analytic tools, processes, and methodologies to achieve the expected results with minimum supervision
• Has a good understanding of Risk business trends and directions to be able to put own work in the broad business context
• Identify glitches in processes and tools and develop and execute solutions to overcome general issues and obstacles with little supervision.
• Learning in-depth analysis of alternatives and applying specialized knowledge
• Impact of decision has moderate reach
• Seeks improvement within defined tasks. Understands, evaluates, and executes improvement ideas from supervisors.
• Build risk related variables based on fraudulent trends and insights
• Partner with key stakeholders to design new risk platform to ensure better quality of risk strategies

Qualifications
• Master’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Statistics, Mathematics, or closely related quantitative discipline plus two (2) years of experience in the job offered or two (2) years of experience in the field of data analysis or statistical analysis
• OR Bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Statistics, Mathematics or closely related quantitative discipline plus three (3) years of experience in the job offered or three (3) years of progressively responsible experience in the field of data analysis or statistical analysis.

Special Skill Requirements:
• Segmentation strategies based on statistical modeling
• Data analysis and visualization
• Machine learning
• PySpark, Python
• SQL
• Hadoop / Hive
• Unix
• Executive/Senior Manager presentation skills
• Story telling skills

Job Description Summary:

We are looking for a senior-level analytics expert to join our team to lead product growth analytics to drive consumer acquisition and engagement. We are looking for someone to be a thought leader for this domain and also leverage data to influence... the strategy.

Job Description:

Roles & Responsibilities:
• Help to launch, measure, and scale new solutions to drive acquisition and engagement
• Identify new opportunities through deep dive analyses leveraging our rich datasets of user behavioral and transactional data
• Translate ambiguous, unstructured business problems into actionable data-driven analyses
• Size potential impact of new ideas and help prioritizing product roadmaps based on impact
• Bring clarity to the performance of our key metrics and flows through well designed dashboards and reports
• Act as thought partner to our product team and lead cross-functional projects (partner teams include product, engineering, design, user research, finance, machine learning, marketing, compliance, risk, customer service/operations)
• Act as mentor to junior team members

Qualifications:
• Bachelors in a quantitative field (math, statistics, computer science, or similar STEM fields), advanced degrees a plus
• 5+ year of data science, analytics, or consulting experience
• Experience influencing product strategy through analyses and data-centric presentations
• Understanding of statistics (e.g. hypothesis testing, statistical inference, regression), experience designing and evaluating complex experiments a plus
• Experience with at least one querying language (e.g. SQL) and one scripting language (e.g. Python), comfortable with working with large, complex, and potentially messy datasets
• Strong interpersonal and project management skills, ability to lead cross-functionally
• Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau a plus, experience with building machine learning models a plus
